contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|metre|meter}} '''Meter''' or '''[[metre]]''' is a unit of measurement of length. '''Meter''' or '''metre''' may also refer to: {{tocright}} ==Spelled ''metre'' or ''meter''== ===Poetry or music=== * [[Metre (poetry)]], the regular linguistic sound patterns of a verse ** [[Dactylic metre (disambiguation)]] * [[Meter (music)]], the regular underlying temporal grid of music * [[Meter (hymn)]], the syllable patterns in hymn stanzas ===Other uses=== * Metre Rule or [[International Rule (sailing)]], for measuring and rating of yachts * [[Metrical phonology]], a theory of stress or prominence of speech units in linguistics ==Spelled ''meter'' only== ===Appliances=== * [[Utility meter (disambiguation)]], metering devices used on utility mains * [[Parking meter]], device to measure vehicle parking time for fees * [[Postage meter]], device measuring monetary usage of postage fees ===Measuring instruments=== * [[Dip meter]], an instrument to measure resonant frequency of radio frequency circuits * [[E-meter]], a modified ohmmeter used during Dianetics and Scientology auditing * [[Electrometer]], an electrical instrument for measuring electric charge or electrical potential difference * [[Glucose meter]], a medical device for determining the approximate concentration of glucose in the blood * [[Multimeter]], an electronic measuring instrument that combines several measurement functions in one unit ===Other uses=== * Meter or [[Cybele]], an Anatolian-Aegean mother goddess * [[The Meters]], a funk band based in New Orleans, Louisiana from the late 1960s until 1977 ==See also== * [[Metric (disambiguation)]] * [[Metric dimension (disambiguation)]] * [[:Category:Measuring instruments]] * {{intitle|meter}} * {{intitle|metre}} {{disambiguation}} [[es:Metro (desambiguaciÃ³n)]]
